title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power approved to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage facility in Everett on former ExxonMobil site.
The facility features two substations, two transmission lines, and will utilize lithium-ion batteries in 816 enclosures.
The storage system is part of Everett's Docklands project, a mixed-use development by Everett Landco and The Davis Companies.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Heated Rivalry' star Connor Storrie hosted SNL's Feb. 28 episode with musical guest Mumford & Sons.
U.S. Olympic hockey players, including Hilary Knight, appeared in the monologue wearing gold medals.
Knight joked on SNL about President Trump's comments inviting both hockey teams to the State of the Union.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 1-0 to the New York Red Bulls, opening the season with two consecutive defeats.
Revolution center-backs Brayan Ceballos and Mamadou Fofana returned, stabilizing the defense despite New York's dominant possession.
New York's relentless press limited the Revolution's passing, while a missed opportunity in the second half sealed New England's fate.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to be ready by Opening Day due to a torn patellar tendon, but may play in spring training.
Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval are progressing in rehab, having recently thrown live batting practice at Fenway South.
Crawford and Sandoval are hopeful, but uncertain, about being ready for the Red Sox's Opening Day roster.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee has installed security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce laws against illegal passing of buses.
The camera system, developed by BusPatrol, automatically activates when school bus stop signs are extended.
The program is cost-free for Chicopee and was authorized by a January 2025 state bill signed by Gov. Maura Healey.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed at Mohegan Sun Arena with a sold-out crowd of 10,000, showcasing blues and ballads.
Stapleton was accompanied by an eight-piece band including pedal steel player Paul Franklin and wife Morgane on vocals.
Stapleton's setlist included hits like 'Tennessee Whiskey', 'Cold', and 'Millionaire', closing with 'Free Bird' and encores.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots may cut Stefon Diggs to save $16.8 million despite his strong season and legal proceedings.
Receivers Mack Hollins, DeMario Douglas, and Kayshon Boutte could be cut or traded to create cap space.
Christian Barmore could be a trade candidate, but cutting him seems unlikely unless it's for a significant return.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in the Celtics' game against the 76ers as he continues recovery from an Achilles injury.
76ers' Joel Embiid will also miss the game due to an oblique strain, potentially sidelining him for three games.
The Celtics are currently second in the Eastern Conference, winning eight of their last ten games.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hits three home runs in the first week of Red Sox spring training, including two against lefties.
Duran's improved performance against left-handed pitchers may influence his role in the 2026 Red Sox lineup.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora noted optimism about Duran's power hitting, which could secure him a spot as designated hitter.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals combined for Boston College in the 2025-26 season.
Seven Bruins draftees participated in Friday's Boston College vs. Boston University game, where BU won 3-1.
Bruins' development strategy benefits from collegiate talent, highlighted by promising prospects at both Boston colleges and other universities.
